description: Excavation to form new basement including front and rear lightwells
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (C33191-100, C33191-101. C33191-102, C33191-103, C33191-104, C33191-105, C33191-106, flood risk assessment, design & access statement Received: 06/01/2022; fire statement Received: 13/01/2022; Construction Method Statement Received: 25/03/2022; Construction Logistics Plan Received: 28/03/2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - The proposal will be carried out in full accordance with the hereby approved Construction Method Statement, any amendments should be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The proposal will be carried out in full accordance with the hereby approved Construction Logistics Plan, any amendments should be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the
person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate
Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of
the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the
site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.
Condition : 8 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.
Condition : 9 - The proposal will be carried out in full accordance with the hereby approved Flood Risk Assessment.

Condition : 10 - a) The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from any sump pump used within the proposed basement shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the pumps operate. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or one metre from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142. An alternative position for assessment/measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria are achieved. 
b) The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.
